turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What's the big deal?  A shark got Overman, and we got the shark.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's just it, Michael.  We don't!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What do you mean, we don't?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: This tooth is from another shark. A shark that could be 30 feet long!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's what I've come to ask you. Is there any large place that has a strong current of water flowing?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What did you just say before? About water flowing through them?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's why they're always moving. They have to have it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You wanted to know about a cave?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's all controlled from the Control Room.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You two go!  I'll call Calvin!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Couple of fractures, lacerations. They say he's gonna be all right.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: ... I have to go, honey.  Phillip and I are going down together to kill the shark.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Michael, you're not going down there.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's a construction job.  I'm the only one that can do it.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Michael, you don't have to go down there.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You don't have to prove anything.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: On the telly.  We're to film him for the evening news.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I just did.  Can you make them do tricks?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: They're not tricks.  They're behavior patterns.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I don't know.  They're nervous and skittish right now.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Okay now.  Have Flipper flip or something.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's no use.  They won't come into the lagoon.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Well then, can you have them jump to the camera over here?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Wait a minute.  These aren't kangaroos, Mr. Hutton.  They're dolphins.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I can have them walk backwards.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I told you, something's upset them.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Well, I have to get this into the networks.  If you can't do it, you can't do it, that's all.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Well, we'll just try again, dear. Keep working on it.  Maybe you'll get it one of these years.  Pack up, boys.  Flipper's a flop.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Unhappy combination.  Most likely one's inside the other.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Sharks are man-biters, Mister Hutton.  Not man-eaters --

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: That's a load of codswopple.  A Great White doesn't fear man.  It doesn't fear beast.  It's an orgy of food and blood.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I think we can capture it.  I'd like to try.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I've handled sharks before. Bigger than this one.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Calvin, let me go down there and kill the bastard.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: It'll chop up half a million dollars of your tropical fish in two minutes.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Calvin, I insist I be allowed to capture it!

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Three hundred million years of evolution have created the greatest butcher the world's ever known.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's one of the world's greatest creatures.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: A shark could have a hundred embryos in its sack.  You know how many are born?  Maybe five. They eat each other before birth! They're born killers!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: The only Great White in captivity, Calvin.  All those people standing in line...

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Well, then I'm going to film it.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Make a lovely item for "Good Morning, America"

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You look like an orange worm.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Shark bait.  Draws them over for closeups.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Lunch for Whitey.  Something to munch on in case things get dicey.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I know it and I will not go down into this lagoon as long as you carry that!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Because I don't trust you, that's why.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I insist you get rid of that bomb.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You're supposed to film it, not turn it to hash!

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Look, Doctor, this isn't one of your pet porpoises we're after. It's a torpedo of muscle. Murderous expertise!  I've seen bleeding sharks try to eat themselves!  Don't be so concerned about them.  Worry about yourself.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Kiss him, maybe he'll turn into a frog.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Should be coming out of it soon.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Just watch it when he does.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Could be a new dance...  Walking the Shark.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I like it when they wake up.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: So do I.  But for different reasons.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: You were quite daring in capturing him.  Very skillful indeed.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Skillful?  I missed my first shot.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: That's what life is, Doctor. Full of chances to hurt yourself, or somebody else.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You're a strange man, Mr. Hutton.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Before, you were ready to feed this shark a hand grenade.  Now you're helping to nurse it back to life.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: That's because I am the shark.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: We're all from the sea, Mr. Hutton. Our destiny is linked to the fate of the oceans.  By continuing to destroy fish, man destroys himself.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: The grenade's just to intimidate Whitey.  He knows I have it, so he watches out.  Same is true when I film lions, tigers, rhinos...

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I think that you and I are natural enemies.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: And here I thought I was charming you.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Hello.  I think his nap's over.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Well, Doctor.  You've got your shark.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Sharks have to keep moving.  They can never stop or they'll suffocate. If water isn't always flowing through them, they'll die.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Is there such a place?  A cave or something with such a flow?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I've heard of a White that big, in Australia...

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: He's big as a bloody bus!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: The water ski show!  We have to get them out!

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: We can assume he's back in the water intake passage.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: He.  She.  Let's blow the bitch up!

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: A piece of pie on Sunday.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: The net would have to be secured by the intake passage.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I think they'll come out now.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I knew it;  it's my fault.  We moved it too soon.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I should have never listened to Calvin.

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: No one's ever done it before. It was a good try...

turns.speaker: RUTH
turns.text: We got it to live for ten hours. That's some kind of record.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hope with none of my girl friends.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Kelly, could you look after Sean for a while?  Show him around for me?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm Neo-Senephrened out.  Think I'm catching a cold.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I was seeing this guy off.  He flew in from Dallas.  Wants to marry me.  He's okay, but Texans are so possessive.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I haven't seen that much, but so far it looks great.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well, wait till you see the rest.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You gonna work at The Kingdom?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: That's too bad.  I don't like water.  I don't like being around in.  I never go in it.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Goes back to when I was a kid. Mike's okay, he's gotten over his fears, but I haven't.  I can't even drink it.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Well, I needed a cold shower.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: This is where to be.  High and dry.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Did you see me?!  Wasn't I terrific?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: No.  Of course not.  Don't listen to him.  He's - he's...  ... my brother.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I don't know, what else is there?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I know!  We can take the gondola ride!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: No, Kelly, I don't want to...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Not for me.  I don't go in the water, remember?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You're not in the water.  You're in a gondola.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Sean, this is ridiculous.  You're acting very immature.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I'm not acting!  I don't want to go in it, okay?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Can hardly wait to do it again.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Taking my boyfriend to the airport.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I thought I was your boyfriend.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Watch it, I'm gonna fall.  I'm gonna go!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: On monitor three.  Was a glimpse of something.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Bring the crane over.  Come down. Easy down.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hutton, how the hell did you get my crane?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Calvin said it was all right.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Well, we're not going to hurt it, old boy.  I say, love, is Flipper ready to go?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Make sure you put this back.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You set that thing off down there, you don't know what will happen.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Watch it, Brody.  You're ruining the shot.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Kind of dull in there for you, isn't it?  Why don't you throw in another shark?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Your friend Overman picked a hell of a time to come back.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I lost a good cameraman in Australia last year.  A Great White chopped him in half with one bite.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey, I don't want to hear.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: That's how they do it, you know. Seizes its prey and shakes its body savagely.  Teeth gnaw through a man like a buzz saw.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I will, old boy, tomorrow.  Our work is done here.  Just came to say goodbye, and good luck.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah?  Well, in that case, have a drink.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: So where you go off to, Hutton? Some expedition in New Guinea or Outer Mongolia?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How come you're so brave with all this stuff?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Tradition.  Royal sense of adventure that's been in my family for centuries.  Dates back to the Crusades and King Richard.  What I was born to do.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, tradition's a bitch, ain't it?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Reach for the limit I always say.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Actually, thirty-five is probably more accurate.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That's impossible.  If it's that big, why hasn't anybody seen it? Huh?  Tell me that.  It's like not seeing the Goodyear blimp in a swimming pool.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Filter system number four.  Is it large enough?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: How far away is filter number four?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: You have a man near it?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: After all, that's how you catch fish, isn't it?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: You could also try a bamboo pole and a worm.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I'll stay out of your way.  I won't interfere.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm sure you won't.  But you're going to have to wait till we come up.  Then you can film all you want.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: He's big, Hutton.  You never saw anything so big.  Watch yourself.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: I know.  But we show it's not closing.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Okay, okay... We'll get someone on it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let us know as soon as you have anything.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: We see him, Mike.  Between the stadium and the ski show island.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: All right, hit those lights too.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey, what's goin' on, little brother!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Damn!  You sonuvabitch!  Look at you!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, we'll find something for you.  Shoveling shark shit or something.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: In a restaurant.  You sit there and they swim around you.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Great.  I got one B, two C's, and eight incompletes.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey, I'm proud of you, kid.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How is he?  Still fighting crime?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Last week he broke up a major counterfeiting ring.  Gang of kids were using slugs in the Pac-Man games.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Big bust!  He confiscate their water pistols?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Booked them all at Baskin- Robbins.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: He taught us good, though, didn't he, Sean?  We were lucky to grow up the way we did.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Gee, it's good to see you!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Just find your own.  Like Dad says, there's plenty of fish in the sea.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Okay, you two, have a good life without me.  I gotta go.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Mike, this is fantastic.  I mean, you're responsible for building all this.  What a job you've done! Maybe I'll quit school and come down here and work with you. Brody Brothers Construction. We've always wanted to do that together.  Boat building.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's not that easy.  Worked construction every summer to get through school.  Three years apprentice in the park's engineering department, and two years to build all this.  Finish school first, Sean.  Then make up your mind.  If you still want to work with me, we'll have plenty of time.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: You and Kathryn gonna stay here?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: This company's expanding.  They got parks in Texas, Ohio, California.  I think I'm gonna be going to Waco.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Well, Dad asked me to ask you this, about the wedding.  Is there any chance you and Kathryn will get married in Amity?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Tell Dad we're getting married in Las Vegas.  In one of those chapels.  He can meet us there.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Yeah, he'll really go for that.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's all up to Kathryn.  Amity's fine with me if it's fine with her.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: No, really.  I've never met anyone like her before.  This is it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, right.  That's what you said about Janet, and Beth, and Barbara --

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Puppy love.  This time it's real! We can have a double wedding.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: We'll shoot this with an .18, boys.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Give me a 400-foot magazine;  we may be down there for a while.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I wouldn't mind going down with her.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: She is a lovely bit of crumpet at that.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Absolutely.  The audience will stain their drawers.  I did.

turns.speaker: THEA
turns.text: Sometimes my father puts me in his lap and lets me steer the Jeep.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: It has its virtues.  It hasn't fallen down yet....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Did you hear what I said?  Come inside....

turns.speaker: THEA
turns.text: I don't want to.  I want to swing....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You're welcome.  I was the one who cried.

turns.speaker: THEA
turns.text: Was Uncle Sean ever bad?  Did you ever spank him?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Only children are my favorites. That means you, MaGee....

turns.speaker: THEA
turns.text: My tea set.  I got my tea set.  Thank you....

turns.speaker: THEA
turns.text: You said it wasn't polite to interrupt people....

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I bought him his first legal drink. He got so pissed that night....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: He told me you both did....

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He was such a good-natured kid... Always going out of his way....

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It was a piece of wood.  A shitty piece of wood.  It's not fair....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What do I think?  I think it's a lovely idea....

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Please, Mom.  At least consider it. You should get away.  You shouldn't be alone now....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I've always wanted to ride one of those....
